intro: Sonchus pitardii, commonly known as the Pitard's sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of pale green, hairy leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing small achenes as seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in fields, and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
